item.title: Edō Ergo Sum: Foodie Hipsterism in the Roman Empire
item.description:
Edō Ergo Sum: Foodie Hipsterism in the Roman Empire

A few months ago, I threw a Roman-themed dinner party. I converted my entire living room into a triclinium, insisted that all my guests dress in togae and stolae, and served them peppered wine, fresh olives, and figs, while ancient Roman and Etruscan music wailed in the background.

item.title: The new MacBook Pro is kind of great for hackers
item.description:
The new MacBook Pro is kind of great for hackers

A million hot takes have been posted about how the late-2016 MacBook Pro with USB-C is the undeniable proof that Apple doesn't care about developers anymore. They took away all the ports! No Esc key! It's just a more expensive MacBook Air!

item.title: in which keyboard science goes further
item.description:
in which keyboard science goes further

My last post documented my initial exposure to the wild world of custom keyboards and the numerous ways it's possible to improve on the conventional design. As I dug deeper into the topic, I was struck with the simplicity of the underlying concepts.

item.title: Webhooks do's and dont's: what we learned after integrating +100 APIs
item.description:
Webhooks do's and dont's: what we learned after integrating +100 APIs

As modern applications are becoming more and more a composite of APIs and the serverless architectures are getting more attention, API providers can't afford any longer to expose only traditional REST endpoints. Traditional REST API are designed for when you want to allow a programmatical retrieve or post content, far from being optimal when you just want your application to be told when something changed.

item.title: When traveling, my iPad is essential and my Mac is the add-on
item.description:
When traveling, my iPad is essential and my Mac is the add-on

For the past year I've been traveling with a 12.9-inch iPad Pro and leaving my MacBook Air home whenever possible. Traveling with only an iPad can feel freeing and it can also feel confining, depending on what you need to accomplish.

item.title: The iPhone 7 Plus is my only computer
item.description:
The iPhone 7 Plus is my only computer

Yes, I'm being sardonic, but not entirely. I really don't use the MBP for much of anything these days, and frankly, I'm not sure I'll ever buy another "big" machine. (I've actually gone a couple months without so much as touching the MBP.)

item.title: Tesla powers a whole island with solar to show off its energy chops
item.description:
Tesla powers a whole island with solar to show off its energy chops

Tesla completed its $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity this week, and, to celebrate, the company has announced a major solar energy project: wiring up the whole island of Ta'u in American Samoa....

item.title: At Sea
item.description:
At Sea

On the defunct language of nautical flags. There are forty flags in a complete set of international maritime signal flags—one for each letter of the English alphabet, one for each number, and four flags called substitutes, which perform special operations.
